cufy.text

Interface Formatter

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Format
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFormat, JSON

    public interface Formatter
    A class that can format objects and write it. With just a simple gate method (for the caller).
    Since:
    31-Mar-2020
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    lsafer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> java.io.Writer format(FormatToken<T> token)
      Write the text outputted from formatting FormatToken.input to the FormatToken.output.
      default <T> java.lang.String format(T object)
      Format the given object.
      default <T> java.io.Writer format(T object, java.io.Writer writer)
      Format the given object and write the text to the given writer.

    • Method Detail

      • format

        default <T> java.lang.String format(T object)
        Format the given object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the given object
        Parameters:
        object - to be formatted into text
        Returns:
        a text from the given object
        Throws:
        FormatException - when any formatting errors occurs

      • format

        default <T> java.io.Writer format(T object,
                                  java.io.Writer writer)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Format the given object and write the text to the given writer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the given object
        Parameters:
        writer - to write to
        object - to be formatted
        Returns:
        the given writer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any IO exception occurs
        FormatException - when any formatting errors occurs
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'writer' is null

      • format

        <T> java.io.Writer format(FormatToken<T> token)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Write the text outputted from formatting FormatToken.input to the FormatToken.output.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the input
        Parameters:
        token - the formatting instance that holds the variables of this formatting
        Returns:
        the writer presented in the token
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O exception occurs
        FormatException - if any formatting exception occurs
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'token' is null
